meanings.definition: Not allocated enough money in a budget.
meanings.sent1: The underbudgeted project struggled to meet its financial goals.
meanings.sent2: The underbudgeted department had to cut back on essential services.
meanings.sent3: The underbudgeted party ran out of snacks before the guests arrived.
meanings.sent4: Her underbudgeted wardrobe lacked the variety she desired.
meanings.sent5: The underbudgeted car repair left the vehicle in a sorry state.

meanings.definition: To have spent less money than was originally planned.
meanings.sent1: They underbudgeted for the event and had to make last-minute changes.
meanings.sent2: She underbudgeted her monthly expenses and had to dip into savings.
meanings.sent3: The company underbudgeted the marketing campaign, resulting in low visibility.
meanings.sent4: He underbudgeted his time for the project, causing delays.
meanings.sent5: The team underbudgeted the resources, leading to a shortage during production.
